This editor allows you to edit TCP/IP Monitor server files.
Use to set the preferences for the TCP/IP monitoring server. The TCP/IP Monitor is a simple server that monitors all the requests and the responses between a Web browser and an application server.
Specify whether to display the TCP/IP Monitor view when there is activity though a TCP/IP monitoring server.

The TCP/IP Monitor table lists the available TCP/IP monitoring servers. You can add, edit, remove, start or stop the available TCP/IP monitoring servers from the TCP/IP Monitor table. The Status column shows if the TCP/IP monitor is started or stopped. The Host name column shows the host name or IP address of the machine where the server is running. The Type column shows whether the request type from the Web browser are sent by HTTP or TCP/IP.

This wizard allows you to add or edit TCP/IP monitoring servers. In the Local monitoring port field, specify a unique port number on your local machine. Use the Host name field under Monitor to specify the host name or IP address of the machine where the server is running. Use the Port field under Monitor to specify the port number of the remote server. Use the Type combination box under Monitor to specify whether the request type from the Web browser are sent by HTTP or TCP/IP. If the HTTP option is selected the requests from the Web browser are: -Modified so that the HTTP header points to the remote machine -Separated if multiple HTTP requests are received in the same connection. If the TCP/IP option is selected, all the requests are sent byte for byte.
The TCP/IP Monitor is a simple server that monitors all the requests and the responses between a Web browser and an application server. You can also use this view to monitor the TCP/IP activity.
A list of requests sent to the application server.
When a request is selected from the list of requests, the Request pane contains information about the request when it is forwarded to the application server.
When a response is selected from the list of responses, the Response pane contains information about the response when it is received from the application server.
The host name or IP address of the machine where the server is running.
The port number of the remote server.
